results.title: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg buys 110 more acres of land in Hawaii for ₹127 crore
results.content: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg and his wife Priscilla Chan have purchased 110 more acres of land on the island of Kauai, Hawaii for $17 million (₹127 crore). With this, total land holdings in Hawaii by Zuckerberg have reached nearly 1,500 acres. The purchase includes a century-old reservoir whose dam broke in 2006, leading to a flood that killed seven people.
results.bottom_headline: Mark buys land 3rd time in Hawaii

results.title: Man with crossbow threatens to kill Queen Elizabeth for Jallianwala Bagh massacre
results.content: Metropolitan Police are investigating a video showing a crossbow-wielding man threatening to kill Queen Elizabeth. In the video, the man identified himself as Jaswant Singh Chail and said he will attempt to assassinate the Queen in revenge for Jallianwala Bagh massacre. On Christmas, a man was arrested for breaking into the grounds of Windsor Castle where the Queen is staying.

results.title: Nepal imposes 2-week quarantine for travellers from 67 nations
results.content: Nepal has imposed a two-week mandatory quarantine for travellers arriving from 67 nations, predominantly from Asia and Europe amid the Omicron variant surge. The passengers from these countries will quarantine themselves in a hotel for seven days, said a statement. The statement added that these passengers will then undergo home quarantine for another seven days even after testing negative.
